name: 組織行為研究
goals: Describe the basic knowledge and theories of organizational behavior and identify the occurrences of them in organizations
Describe current research in organizational behavior and identify how they can be applied to workplace settings
Understand how application of OB concepts can enhance individual, group, and organizational effectiveness
syllabus:
Tentative weekly schedule:
--------------------------

Week 1  **Introduction of OB and course overview**

Week 2  **Foundations of Individual Behavior, Diversity in Organizations**

Week 3  **Attitudes and Job Satisfaction**

Week 4  **Emotions and Moods**

Week 5  **Personality and Values**

Week 6  **Perception and Individual Decision Making**

Week 7  **Motivation**

Week 8  **Miderm**

Week 9  **Foundations of Group Behavior**

Week 10  **Understanding Work Teams**

Week 11  **Communication**

Week 12  **Leadership**

Week 13  **Power and Politics**

Week 14  **Conflict and Negotiation**

Week 15  **The Organizational System, Organizational Culture**

Week 16  **Final Exam**

methodologies.note: Important issues and trends in OB studies will be introduced
Students will discuss related issues and trends introduced by the instructor and research topics presented by fellow students
Students will work in teams in class activities and assignments to learn how to collaborate with others.
Audio visual materials will be used to introduce phenomenon in organizations.
Students will carry out case studies of current problems in OB.

grading.note: Mid-term exam is administered to test students' comprehension of OB concepts.
Final exam is administered to test students' comprehension of OB concepts.
Read texts and other supplementary materials before class, actively participate in class activities & discussions, and provide feedback to peers to enrich the learning.
Attendance is required. 5 points out of the total 100 points toward attendances will be deducted for each unapproved absence.
Students are required to introduce and present the case study report in class.
Students will carry out a case analysis of a current problem in an organization. Students are required to present the project orally in class and submit the completed written research report.

prerequisite: ◎Unavailable for M.A. program students (M.A. program courses excepted) and B.A. program students.
